byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jack Healy, Julie Turkewitz, Dave Philipps and Kassondra Cloos from Colorado Springs; Alan Blinder from Swannanoa, N.C.; and Ashley Southall, Mike McIntire and Liam Stack from New York. Jack Begg contributed research.

abstract: Court documents and interviews with acquaintances of Robert L Dear Jr, suspect in shooting at Planned Parenthood clinic in Colorado Springs, reveal man of deep contradictions; witnesses say Dear professed Christian values but was abuser and serial adulterer who craved both solitude and constant company of women; some report Dear was extremely anti-abortion, while others say he did not seem that concerned with it.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Dear was a man of religious conviction who sinned openly, and a man who craved both extreme solitude and female company. Some women say he abused them.

headline.main: For Robert Dear, Religion and Rage Before Planned Parenthood Attack
headline.print_headline: Religion, Abuse and Rage in Colorado Suspect’s Trail

snippet: Mr. Dear was a man of religious conviction who sinned openly, and a man who craved both extreme solitude and female company. Some women say he abused them.
